result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney S Haysmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rodney S Haysmer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rodney S Haysmer was found guilty of Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Rodney S Haysmer
Current: 421 Broadway St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 01-22-2016)
Prior: 355 W. Oak St, Redgranite, WI 54970 United States
Judgment of conviction has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to:  421 Broadway St  Berlin, WI   54923

9:19 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - restitution needs to be paid by 12/22 and will plea to count 1 and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed.  Statement by DA - restitution has been paid.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the restitution be paid to the victim.

Court adjourned at 9:24 a.m.
Status hearing at 12-22-2015 09:15 am

9:43 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney and will accept offer.  DA recites offer, upon payment of restitution and plea to count 1, will recommend costs.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 22, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:45 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing at 11-24-2015 09:15 am
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant to make an appointment with the District Attorney.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 24, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:50 a.m.
